com.compendium.core.db.management
Class DBAdminDerbyDatabase

java.lang.Object
  com.compendium.core.db.management.DBAdminDatabase
      com.compendium.core.db.management.DBAdminDerbyDatabase
All Implemented Interfaces:
DBConstants, DBConstantsDerby, DBConstantsMySQL, java.io.Serializable
public class DBAdminDerbyDatabase
extends DBAdminDatabase
implements DBConstants, DBConstantsDerby

This class is responsible for creating and accessing the Derby administration database that Compendium uses for maintaining the list of user created database and global system properties. For DERBY Databases

Author:
Michelle Bachler
See Also:
Serialized Form

Constructor Detail

DBAdminDerbyDatabase

public DBAdminDerbyDatabase(IServiceManager service)
Constructor, which stores the ServiceManager and DatabaseManager references and asks the DatabaseManager to open a new project for the administration database.

Parameters:
IServiceManager - service, a reference to an instance of a ServiceManager object.

DBAdminDerbyDatabase

public DBAdminDerbyDatabase(IServiceManager service,
                            java.lang.String sDatabaseName,
                            java.lang.String sDatabasePassword)
Constructor, which stores the ServiceManager and DatabaseManager references and asks the DatabaseManager to open a new project for the administration database. This constructor also takes a name and password to use when accessing the MySQL database and uses 'localhost' as the address.

Parameters:
IServiceManager - service, a reference to an instance of a ServiceManager object.
sDatabaseName, - the name to use when creating the connection to the MySQL database
sDatabasePassword, - the password to use when connection to the MySQL database

DBAdminDerbyDatabase

public DBAdminDerbyDatabase(IServiceManager service,
                            java.lang.String sDatabaseName,
                            java.lang.String sDatabasePassword,
                            java.lang.String sDatabaseIP)
Constructor, which stores the ServiceManager and DatabaseManager references and asks the DatabaseManager to open a new project for the administration database. This constructor also takes a name and password to use when accessing the MySQL database, and the IP address of the MysqL server machine.

Parameters:
IServiceManager - service, a reference to an instance of a ServiceManager object.
sDatabaseName, - the name to use when creating the connection to the MySQL database
sDatabasePassword, - the password to use when connection to the MySQL database
sDatabaseIP, - the IP address of the MySQL server machine. The default if 'localhost'.
Method Detail

firstTime

public boolean firstTime()
                  throws java.sql.SQLException,
                         java.lang.ClassNotFoundException
Check if this is the first time compendium is being opened, by checking if the Derby Compendium administration database exists. If it does return false return false, else true.

Throws:
java.sql.SQLException
java.lang.ClassNotFoundException

checkAdminDatabase

public boolean checkAdminDatabase()
                           throws java.sql.SQLException,
                                  java.lang.ClassNotFoundException
Check that the Derby Compendium administration database exists. If not, it must be the first time Compendium is being used, so create it.

Overrides:
checkAdminDatabase in class DBAdminDatabase
Throws:
java.sql.SQLException
java.lang.ClassNotFoundException

deleteDatabase

public boolean deleteDatabase(java.lang.String sProjectName,
                              java.lang.String sDatabaseName)
                       throws java.sql.SQLException
Delete the database with the given database name. For Derby this involves deleting all the files and folders associated with the database and then the record from the project table.

Overrides:
deleteDatabase in class DBAdminDatabase
Parameters:
String - sFriendlyName, the 'user friendly' name for a database project.
String - sDatabaseName, the actual database name as it is known in MySQL.
Returns:
if the database was successfully deleted.
Throws:
java.sql.SQLException
